Instrument.name: The Medium Resolution Instrument (MRI) for Deep Impact
Instrument.description: The MRI consisted of a telescope, filter wheel, and Charged-Couple Device (CCD) detector. The telescope was a Cassegrain design, f/17.5 with a 12 cm diameter aperture and a 2.1 m focal length. The filter wheel had two clear apertures and eight filters. The filters included some of the same filters used on the HRI visible CCD, and also had filters designed to isolate CN and C2. The detector was a 1024 x 1024 split frame transfer CCD. The field of view was 10 milliradians (0.587 degrees, or 10 microradians/pixel) allowing a surface resolution of 7 meters at 700 km.
